svg.text: SQLite Session Extension for Diesel ORM
Change tracking, bidirectional sync, and replication for Rust applications

div.style: font-family: Inter, SF Pro Display, system-ui, sans-serif; font-size: 11px; color: #475569; text-align: justify; line-height: 1.5;

foreignObject.div: Real-time database synchronization for Rust applications. This library wraps SQLite's official session extension for the Diesel ORM, enabling change tracking (INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE) and generation of patchsets (a standard SQLite binary format). These patchsets can be transmitted via WebSocket and applied to remote SQLite databases with configurable conflict resolution. Supports native targets and WebAssembly. External CDC sources (PostgreSQL, Kafka) can generate compatible patchsets using sqlite-diff-rs.

g.text: Architecture — Backend CDC to Frontend via WebSocket
Database changes are captured, converted to compact updates, sent in real-time, and applied to the browser's local database
diesel: 12-18% faster for data-heavy ops | ~5% overhead for setup
Performance comparable; choose based on ORM preference
Chrome and Firefox show comparable performance within variance
// Generate patchset (to send to other peers)
// Apply incoming patchset (from any peer or sqlite-diff-rs)
